comment: Do not take this professor. He's a nice guy in class, but grades unbelievably harshly. His expectations are insane. His feedback is passive-aggressive and accusatory. His tests are written and he expects you to memorize an enormous amount of information. His study guides are just all of the PowerPoint slides written out so they don't help.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy

comment: Took him over Summer '22 for his 4-week online course & he was very easy. Would've made an A if I didn't slack & miss turning in a mini project & done 2 of his extra credit opportunities. Take him! Pretty laid-back but make sure you turn in everything by the due dates!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Kiernan uses lectured powerpoints for notes and a textbook too. In terms of the quizzes, the questions are easy if you know the material. The final projects are easy, in my opinion, as they just ask you to look at some art and analyze it. Not a hard class in particular if you do what you are supposed to, but was nothing special either.
Don't believe the haters! Didn't want to take this gen ed class, ended up loving it. I would take him again in a heartbeat, but I'm in engineering, so I don't need his other classes for my degree.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: He loves what he teacher but sadly this class is just 3 tests and a paper. The tests aren't open book and are short answer. If you misspelled a Greek word, it is wrong. It is a lot of information and it's very hard to study for. He is a tough graders. Nice guy who loves his job and research but tough class!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: His online 2750 was a nice class, and I enjoyed him so much there I thought it'd be good take him here. I was wrong. Take anyone else for an Art History Elective. His tests here are all short answer with no open note, and the questions here are more oddball/specific. That, and there's a paper which creeps up at the end, which he is unclear about.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Really well rounded professor but its a hard class. Attendance isnt mandatory but you will fail if you dont show up. Notes are a must and you really need to be ready to study. It was fun having a professor who was well rounded in the field and actually excavated. End of term paper is huge too, and you need to prepare ahead of time or else..
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Amazing prof. for Art and Mythology class. Lectures were funny and interesting. Focus was Greek and Roman. I loved it, highly recommend Prof. Kiernan
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: I had him for Ancient through Medieval Art, and I absolutely loved the experience. Consistently funny, passionate about his work, and goes in-depth about the topic without being boring or overly descriptive. He does get a bit discouraged when people don't come to class, so if you show up as expected, you will gain his favor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Had good lectures that made sense and study guides that properly prepared you for the tests but refuses to take the blame on docking you points even if he messed up or wasn't clear. Would give a much higher rating if he didn't grade everyone in my class very harshly on the last few projects without being reasonable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Tough grader

comment: i'm not into art but he made the class good
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: best class and prof this year
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures

comment: Super class on ancient Greek art and great lectures. Clear instructions, very fair and well organized online. I learned a lot about ancient art and archaeology. Would take anytime.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Awesome Prof. Class moved to online suddenly bc of covid, but handled way smoother than any other of my Profs. Super interesting too, highly reccommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I switched my major to Art History after taking this and took Art and Mythology with him. He is really knowledgable and a great lecturer and helped me with essays in Mythology. A lot of studio kids don't like Art History classes and skip a lot. Don't do that. I came for Digital Animation and didn't like it, wish I knew about Art History before.

Prof. Kiernan is an awesome guy and his lectures are very interesting to listen to. The class helped me become interested in art history. The tests, however, are very difficult, and you'll be memorizing a lot of information for them. Our class had 4 tests, and 25-30 artworks to memorize + key terms and dates for each one.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Amazing lectures--Tough grader

comment: The worst professor I have ever had. Refused to take blame or credit whenever he was at fault. For one of the test he presented us chapter 5,6, and 7 and left the 6th chapter off the test. Instead of taking it off the test, he gave us an old test with a different section, and attempted to deflect the blame by saying "I meant I was only testing 5&7.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Don't get me wrong, he is a really nice guy and very passionate, but he is very difficult to please. I love art history, and I have always been fascinated by it, but this prof. makes me feel like he wants his students to have a hard time it seems like. Be prepared to study, and for the little things you would never guess that would be on the test.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: There was a ton of material to know for the tests. There were about 100+ powerpoint slides filled with information and about 30-35 questions on a test. He grades really tough and expects you to know every little detail. He's nice, but I would never take him again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I did really well in this class but I would never take him again nor recommend him. He is unprofessional and his standards are confusing. He is disorganized which makes the tests "hard" There is no learning in this class just regurgitating. Take it online if you can.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: There too much material to memorize for 3 test, which by the is worth 60% of your grade. Doesn't give out the right information for the study guides and will change it. He a nice dude but it's his teaching style that the issue.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: my flash cards for each test consisted of 150+ cards, and then the tests only have around 30 (written answer) questions. he wants you to learn and memorize an insane amount of information. philip kiernan is passionate about the topic he teaches, and i respect that, but he seriously needs to reconsider how his class is structured.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: By far one of my least favorite professors. Over the semester I learned that he is pretentious and very critical; he expects you to know every little thing about works of art and makes subtle fun of students for not being geniuses. Tests are very hard to make As on and each one had me nauseous with dread to take. Made art history terrible to take.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I like this professor because he is straight forward and informs you well about the tests. You definitely have to take a lot of notes and study hard for the tests, but none of the questions are tricky. Basically everything you study is on the test and he gives study guides and posts PowerPoints.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I really was not excited about taking an art class, however Prof Kiernan made it bearable and on most days enjoyable. Lectures were interesting, group projects were easy, and tests were easy if you looked at material. He is understanding and provides good feedback.
rating_tags: Respected--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The class is lecture heavy with 3 tests. The tests are pretty straight forward and he gives you a study guide. My least favorite aspects were the frequent group assignments, but they are easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I'm not really interested in Art, but he made the class fairly interesting. There are 3 tests (no final) and 4 group projects with 1 that you have to present to the class. Also, you have to visit a museum and complete a worksheet about it, but that was pretty easy as well. He also gives various opportunities for bonus points/extra credit.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I dreaded taking an Art class. But this class is not bad at all you have 3 test over key terms and group presentations that are mc and true/false. The final is a museum report that is super easy. Gives some bonus if some up some days and on test! Take for art for sure!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Typical Art History professor who thinks you need to memorize tons of information you most likely will never use. He says he's not a tough grader, but he definitely is. He made me dread learning about a subject area that I was originally very interested in learning about.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great guy, he's Canadian. He loves art and the class is easy if you just take the notes. Be aware that, even though he posts the power points online, they don't have a lot of information on them, so I would go to class. Super easy tests and group projects are simple.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: does not seem mean but a little bit hard to talk to. there are only three tests but they cover everything so you need to get good grades on all of them.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Kiernan is absolutely amazing! Hes funny and is really passionate about art history. You really need to study for the tests, but hes not a tough grader and as long you go to class and pay attention youre going to know the material. One of my favorite teachers so far.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He definitely knows what he's talking about. Nice guy but can be condescending. 3 tests, a research exercise, a paper, and a museum visit with write up. Grades pretty fairly but can be picky. Gives extra credit. Sheer memorization of about 40 artworks (identification and significance) for each test.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took Dr. Kiernan's Art 1107 Maymester course. He made a class that i was annoyed at having to take VERY enjoyable.  If you are required to take an arts class this is the one to take.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Amazing lectures
